snippet: On the Internet he was Sabu, a notorious celebrity who led a scattered tribe of politically motivated “hacktivists.” Then he slipped into the role of federal informant.
abstract: Hector Xavier Monsegur was known as Sabu on the Internet, a notorious celebrity who led a scattered tribe of politically motivated 'hacktivists,' but court papers reveal that he slipped into the role of federal informant; as an informant, he helped bring down a batch of prominent fellow hackers in Europe and the United States, who were indicted for computer crimes that the authorities said affected one million victims, along with major companies and government agencies.

byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by William Rashbaum, Nicole Perlroth, Tim Stelloh, Alex Vadukul, Toby Lyles and Jenny Anderson.

lead_paragraph: On the Internet he was Sabu, a notorious celebrity who led a scattered tribe of politically motivated “hacktivists.” Then he slipped into the role of federal informant.

headline.main: Hacker, Informant and Party Boy of the Projects
headline.print_headline: Hacker, Informant and Party Boy of the Projects
